review.title: Rational Kernels for Arabic Stemming and Text Classification
review.abstract: In this paper, we address the problems of Arabic Text Classification and stemming using Transducers and Rational Kernels. We introduce a new stemming technique based on the use of Arabic patterns (Pattern Based Stemmer). Patterns are modelled using transducers and stemming is done without depending on any dictionary. Using transducers for stemming, documents are transformed into finite state transducers. This document representation allows us to use and explore rational kernels as a framework for Arabic Text Classification. Stemming experiments are conducted on three word collections and classification experiments are done on the Saudi Press Agency dataset. Results show that our approach, when compared with other approaches, is promising specially in terms of Accuracy, Recall and F1.

sections.text: Arabic text classification and stemming with transducers and rational kernels. We introduce a new stemming technique based on the use of Arabic patterns (Pattern Based Stemmers). Patterns are modelled with transducers and stemming is done without dependence on a dictionary. Converters are used to transform documents into finite state converters. This document representation allows us to use and explore rational cores as a framework for Arabic text classification. Stemming experiments are carried out with three word collections and classification experiments are carried out on the Saudi Press Agency dataset. Results show that our approach is promising compared to other approaches, particularly in terms of accuracy, recall and F1.Keywords N-gram · Arabic · Classification · Rational Cores · Automata.

They can be divided into two types: (i) parentage from a dictionary in which dictionary letters must be removed from the dictionary; (ii) parentage from dictionary letters in which dictionary letters must be used; (ii) parentage without dictionary in which stem letters are extracted without specifying the root or pattern. sections.heading: 4 Framework for Arabic Stemming and Text Classification
sections.text: In the following, we will explain how to use transducers to capture the first three letters. First, Arabic patterns, prefixes and suffixes are modeled by simple transducers, then a transducer is constructed using these simple patterns, applying rational patterns such as concatenation, union and composition, then we will show how to use rational cores as frames to construct ATC.Stemming by TransducersArabic language differs from other languages syntactically, morphologically and semantically. One of the most important characteristic features is that most words are built from roots by taking certain fixed patterns into account and adding prefixes and suffixes. sections.heading: 6 Conclusion
sections.text: In this paper, we have introduced a new framework for Arabic word origin and text classification based on the use of parentage converters and rational cores to measure the distance between documents. First, our converter uses converters to model Arabic patterns. Second, rational cores are used to measure the distances between documents. Experiments and analysis of this framework in the context of Arabic text classification show that parentage improves the quality of classifiers in terms of accuracy, memory and F1, but slightly reduces precision. 3 gram classifiers achieved the best results. Like Al-Serhan's, our approaches to parentage are not based on dictionaries and provide better results.
